snippet: Brian Foley testified that former Gov. John G. Rowland of Connecticut accepted $35,000 for campaign consulting on the pretext that he was helping Mr. Foley’s businesses.
abstract: Brian Foley, government's star witness in corruption case against former Connecticut Gov John G Rowland, testifies that Rowland accepted $35,000 for campaign consulting on the pretext that he was helping Foley’s businesses; Rowland faces violation of campaign finance laws that could send him back to prison.

byline.original: By ALISON LEIGH COWAN and KRISTIN HUSSEY

lead_paragraph: Brian Foley testified that former Gov. John G. Rowland of Connecticut accepted $35,000 for campaign consulting on the pretext that he was helping Mr. Foley’s businesses.

headline.main: Witness Details a Sham in a Deal With Rowland
headline.print_headline: Witness Details a Sham in a Deal With Rowland
